us.ihmc.euclid.geometry

Class Pose3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.Pose3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Pose3DBasics, Pose3DReadOnly, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<Pose3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<Pose3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<Pose3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<Pose3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable

    public class Pose3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements Pose3DBasics, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<Pose3D>
    A Pose3D represents a position and orientation in 3 dimensions.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pose3D

        public Pose3D()
        Creates a new pose 3D initialized with its position at (0, 0, 0) and orientation set to the neutral quaternion, i.e. zero rotation.

      • Pose3D

        public Pose3D(double x,
              double y,
              double z,
              double yaw,
              double pitch,
              double roll)
        Creates a new pose 3D and initializes it with the given parameters.

        WARNING: the Euler angles or yaw-pitch-roll representation is sensitive to gimbal lock and is sometimes undefined.

        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the position.
        y - the y-coordinate of the position.
        z - the z-coordinate of the position.
        yaw - the first angle from the yaw-pitch-roll representation, represents a rotation about the z-axis.
        pitch - the second angle from the yaw-pitch-roll representation, represents a rotation about the y-axis.
        roll - the third angle from the yaw-pitch-roll representation, represents a rotation about the x-axis.

      • Pose3D

        public Pose3D(Pose2DReadOnly pose2DReadOnly)
        Creates a new pose 3D and initializes to represent the same pose as the given pose2DReadOnly.
        Parameters:
        pose2DReadOnly - the pose 2D used to initialize this pose 3D. Not modified.

      • Pose3D

        public Pose3D(Pose3DReadOnly other)
        Creates a new pose 3D and initializes it to other.
        Parameters:
        other - the other pose 3D used to initialize this. Not modified.

      • Pose3D

        Creates a new pose 3D and initializes it with the given rigid-body transform.
        Parameters:
        rigidBodyTransform - the transform used to initialize this. Not modified.

      • Pose3D

        public Pose3D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly position,
              us.ihmc.euclid.tuple4D.interfaces.QuaternionReadOnly orientation)
        Creates a new pose 3D and initializes it with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        position - tuple used to initialize the position part of this pose. Not modified.
        orientation - used to initialize the orientation part of this pose. Not modified.

      • epsilonEquals

        public boolean epsilonEquals(Pose3D other,
                             double epsilon)
        Tests on a per-component basis if this pose is equal to other with the tolerance epsilon.
        Specified by:
        epsilonEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<Pose3D>
        Parameters:

        epsilon - the tolerance to use.
        Returns:
        true if the two poses are equal, false otherwise.

      • geometricallyEquals

        public boolean geometricallyEquals(Pose3D other,
                                   double epsilon)
        Compares this to other to determine if the two poses are geometrically similar.

        Two poses are geometrically equal if both their position and orientation are geometrically equal.

        Specified by:
        geometricallyEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<Pose3D>
        Parameters:
        other - the pose to compare to. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the two poses represent the same geometry, false otherwise.
